        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is an use after free in virtwl_ioctl_recv(drivers/virtio/virtio_wl.c):<span class="line"><!---->There is an use after free in virtwl_ioctl_recv(drivers/virtio/virtio_wl.c):<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static long virtwl_ioctl_recv(struct file *filp, void __user *ptr)<span class="line"><!---->static long virtwl_ioctl_recv(struct file *filp, void __user *ptr)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>	ret = virtwl_vfd_recv(filp, user_data, ioctl_recv.len, vfds, [1] vfds come from recv buffer<span class="line"><!---->	ret = virtwl_vfd_recv(filp, user_data, ioctl_recv.len, vfds, [1] vfds come from recv buffer<!----></span><br>			      &vfd_count);<span class="line"><!---->			      &amp;vfd_count);<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br><br>	for (i = 0; i < vfd_count; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->	for (i = 0; i &lt; vfd_count; i++) {<!----></span><br>		ret = anon_inode_getfd("[virtwl_vfd]", &virtwl_vfd_fops, [4] vfds contains the same vfd object, all file->private_data pointer to the same vfd object<span class="line"><!---->		ret = anon_inode_getfd("[virtwl_vfd]", &amp;virtwl_vfd_fops, [4] vfds contains the same vfd object, all file-&gt;private_data pointer to the same vfd object<!----></span><br>				       vfds[i], virtwl_vfd_file_flags(vfds[i])<span class="line"><!---->				       vfds[i], virtwl_vfd_file_flags(vfds[i])<!----></span><br>				       | O_CLOEXEC);<span class="line"><!---->				       | O_CLOEXEC);<!----></span><br>		if (ret < 0)<span class="line"><!---->		if (ret &lt; 0)<!----></span><br>			goto free_vfds;<span class="line"><!---->			goto free_vfds;<!----></span><br><br>		vfds[i] = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->		vfds[i] = NULL;<!----></span><br>		fds[i] = ret;<span class="line"><!---->		fds[i] = ret;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>vfds[i] controlled by attacker in vfd_out_vfds_locked(drivers/virtio/virtio_wl.c):<span class="line"><!---->vfds[i] controlled by attacker in vfd_out_vfds_locked(drivers/virtio/virtio_wl.c):<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static size_t vfd_out_vfds_locked(struct virtwl_vfd *vfd,<span class="line"><!---->static size_t vfd_out_vfds_locked(struct virtwl_vfd *vfd,<!----></span><br>				  struct virtwl_vfd **vfds, size_t count)<span class="line"><!---->				  struct virtwl_vfd **vfds, size_t count)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>        [...]<span class="line"><!---->        [...]<!----></span><br><br>		__le32 *vfds_le = (__le32 *)((void *)recv + vfd_offset); [2] vfds_le parsed from recv buffer<span class="line"><!---->		__le32 *vfds_le = (__le32 *)((void *)recv + vfd_offset); [2] vfds_le parsed from recv buffer<!----></span><br>		[...]<span class="line"><!---->		[...]<!----></span><br><br>		for (i = 0; i < vfds_to_read; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->		for (i = 0; i &lt; vfds_to_read; i++) {<!----></span><br>			uint32_t vfd_id = le32_to_cpu(vfds_le[i]);<span class="line"><!---->			uint32_t vfd_id = le32_to_cpu(vfds_le[i]);<!----></span><br>			vfds[read_count] = idr_find(&vi->vfds, vfd_id);      [3] attacker can assign the same vfd_id, make vfds contains the same vfd object<span class="line"><!---->			vfds[read_count] = idr_find(&amp;vi-&gt;vfds, vfd_id);      [3] attacker can assign the same vfd_id, make vfds contains the same vfd object<!----></span><br>			if (vfds[read_count]) {<span class="line"><!---->			if (vfds[read_count]) {<!----></span><br>				read_count++;<span class="line"><!---->				read_count++;<!----></span><br>			} else {<span class="line"><!---->			} else {<!----></span><br>				pr_warn("virtwl: received a vfd with unrecognized id: %u\n",<span class="line"><!---->				pr_warn("virtwl: received a vfd with unrecognized id: %u\n",<!----></span><br>					vfd_id);<span class="line"><!---->					vfd_id);<!----></span><br>			}<span class="line"><!---->			}<!----></span><br>			qentry->vfd_offset++;<span class="line"><!---->			qentry-&gt;vfd_offset++;<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br><br>		vfd_qentry_free_if_empty(vfd, qentry);<span class="line"><!---->		vfd_qentry_free_if_empty(vfd, qentry);<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	return read_count;<span class="line"><!---->	return read_count;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>If attacker can control recv buffer, attacker can make vfds list contains the same vfd object[1][2][3], then all file->private_data pointer to the same vfd object[4],<span class="line"><!---->If attacker can control recv buffer, attacker can make vfds list contains the same vfd object[1][2][3], then all file-&gt;private_data pointer to the same vfd object[4],<!----></span><br>when the process exit and call virtwl_vfd_release to release fds, it will tigger an use after free.<span class="line"><!---->when the process exit and call virtwl_vfd_release to release fds, it will tigger an use after free.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 110.0.5481.181<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 110.0.5481.181<!----></span><br>Operating System: chromeos 5.10.159-20950-g3963226d9eb4<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: chromeos 5.10.159-20950-g3963226d9eb4<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>I audit this vulnerability and still working for a poc.<span class="line"><!---->I audit this vulnerability and still working for a poc.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        FYI:<span class="line"><!---->FYI:<!----></span><br><br>The exploitation path would be VMM->guest or guest->(via VMM)->guest (since the guest itself could trigger the exploit). But with just this bug, I don't see any feasible way for the guest to exploit the VMM.<span class="line"><!---->The exploitation path would be VMM-&gt;guest or guest-&gt;(via VMM)-&gt;guest (since the guest itself could trigger the exploit). But with just this bug, I don't see any feasible way for the guest to exploit the VMM.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1424269#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 19, 2023, 11:18 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1424269#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 19, 2023, 11:18 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Severity-Low Security_Severity-Medium Pri-1
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Severity-Low Security_Severity-Medium Pri-1
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Exploitability - Explain why/why not the bug is reachable and/or exploitable For example, if a bug mentions a race, details are needed about how easy that race would be to achieve / can the attack retry infinite times to win the race, etc..<span class="line"><!---->Exploitability - Explain why/why not the bug is reachable and/or exploitable For example, if a bug mentions a race, details are needed about how easy that race would be to achieve / can the attack retry infinite times to win the race, etc..<!----></span><br><br>The path of exploitation here is host->guest via virtio-wl. The bug can potentially exploit a freed file descriptor if they control the recv buffer in the host user space.<span class="line"><!---->The path of exploitation here is host-&gt;guest via virtio-wl. The bug can potentially exploit a freed file descriptor if they control the recv buffer in the host user space.<!----></span><br><br>Note there was no evidence of exploitation provided and just a speculative potential security bug.<span class="line"><!---->Note there was no evidence of exploitation provided and just a speculative potential security bug.<!----></span><br><br>Privileges and Capabilities - Identify which process is exploited and where code execution potentially can be achieved if the attacker can break out of that process, and explain why<span class="line"><!---->Privileges and Capabilities - Identify which process is exploited and where code execution potentially can be achieved if the attacker can break out of that process, and explain why<!----></span><br><br>Host user space to Guest is what can be exploited here, which is a higher privileged process to a lower privileged process.<span class="line"><!---->Host user space to Guest is what can be exploited here, which is a higher privileged process to a lower privileged process.<!----></span><br><br>Origin of fix - Is the issue already known upstream, fixed by work from a previously known or reported issue, provided by the reporter, or any other information that would be relevant toward reward eligibility<span class="line"><!---->Origin of fix - Is the issue already known upstream, fixed by work from a previously known or reported issue, provided by the reporter, or any other information that would be relevant toward reward eligibility<!----></span><br><br>It was fixed upstream and is a new issue.<span class="line"><!---->It was fixed upstream and is a new issue.<!----></span><br><br>Mitigation - Detail any regarding mitigation considerations (we're run across a few comments, such as "we considered this issue to be highly mitigated" without explanation)<span class="line"><!---->Mitigation - Detail any regarding mitigation considerations (we're run across a few comments, such as "we considered this issue to be highly mitigated" without explanation)<!----></span><br><br>The bug goes from user->guest, which in theory can be expected, i.e going from a high to a low privileged process<span class="line"><!---->The bug goes from user-&gt;guest, which in theory can be expected, i.e going from a high to a low privileged process<!----></span><br><br>Severity assessment - why not higher, why not lower .<span class="line"><!---->Severity assessment - why not higher, why not lower .<!----></span><br><br>Medium Severity: This could allow the attacker to "allow attackers to read or modify limited amounts of information" in the guest userspace. Which already is very limited. It is also "Memory corruption in a system service that's not directly triggerable from an exposed interface"<span class="line"><!---->Medium Severity: This could allow the attacker to "allow attackers to read or modify limited amounts of information" in the guest userspace. Which already is very limited. It is also "Memory corruption in a system service that's not directly triggerable from an exposed interface"<!----></span><br><br>Why not High Severity? There is no low->high privileged bypass happening here which would make it high.<span class="line"><!---->Why not High Severity? There is no low-&gt;high privileged bypass happening here which would make it high.<!----></span><br><br>Why not Low Severity? I think there is a case that be made here that this is a low severity, since there are high mitigation factors (such as being in the userspace), but this also potentially allows for malicious users to read/modify such information that could be used in a higher severity bug."<span class="line"><!---->Why not Low Severity? I think there is a case that be made here that this is a low severity, since there are high mitigation factors (such as being in the userspace), but this also potentially allows for malicious users to read/modify such information that could be used in a higher severity bug."<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Comment 17<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1424269#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }

    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      <chops-dialog>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is an use after free in virtwl_ioctl_recv(drivers/virtio/virtio_wl.c):<span class="line"><!---->There is an use after free in virtwl_ioctl_recv(drivers/virtio/virtio_wl.c):<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static long virtwl_ioctl_recv(struct file *filp, void __user *ptr)<span class="line"><!---->static long virtwl_ioctl_recv(struct file *filp, void __user *ptr)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>	ret = virtwl_vfd_recv(filp, user_data, ioctl_recv.len, vfds, [1] vfds come from recv buffer<span class="line"><!---->	ret = virtwl_vfd_recv(filp, user_data, ioctl_recv.len, vfds, [1] vfds come from recv buffer<!----></span><br>			      &vfd_count);<span class="line"><!---->			      &amp;vfd_count);<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br><br>	for (i = 0; i < vfd_count; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->	for (i = 0; i &lt; vfd_count; i++) {<!----></span><br>		ret = anon_inode_getfd("[virtwl_vfd]", &virtwl_vfd_fops, [4] vfds contains the same vfd object, all file->private_data pointer to the same vfd object<span class="line"><!---->		ret = anon_inode_getfd("[virtwl_vfd]", &amp;virtwl_vfd_fops, [4] vfds contains the same vfd object, all file-&gt;private_data pointer to the same vfd object<!----></span><br>				       vfds[i], virtwl_vfd_file_flags(vfds[i])<span class="line"><!---->				       vfds[i], virtwl_vfd_file_flags(vfds[i])<!----></span><br>				       | O_CLOEXEC);<span class="line"><!---->				       | O_CLOEXEC);<!----></span><br>		if (ret < 0)<span class="line"><!---->		if (ret &lt; 0)<!----></span><br>			goto free_vfds;<span class="line"><!---->			goto free_vfds;<!----></span><br><br>		vfds[i] = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->		vfds[i] = NULL;<!----></span><br>		fds[i] = ret;<span class="line"><!---->		fds[i] = ret;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>vfds[i] controlled by attacker in vfd_out_vfds_locked(drivers/virtio/virtio_wl.c):<span class="line"><!---->vfds[i] controlled by attacker in vfd_out_vfds_locked(drivers/virtio/virtio_wl.c):<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static size_t vfd_out_vfds_locked(struct virtwl_vfd *vfd,<span class="line"><!---->static size_t vfd_out_vfds_locked(struct virtwl_vfd *vfd,<!----></span><br>				  struct virtwl_vfd **vfds, size_t count)<span class="line"><!---->				  struct virtwl_vfd **vfds, size_t count)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>        [...]<span class="line"><!---->        [...]<!----></span><br><br>		__le32 *vfds_le = (__le32 *)((void *)recv + vfd_offset); [2] vfds_le parsed from recv buffer<span class="line"><!---->		__le32 *vfds_le = (__le32 *)((void *)recv + vfd_offset); [2] vfds_le parsed from recv buffer<!----></span><br>		[...]<span class="line"><!---->		[...]<!----></span><br><br>		for (i = 0; i < vfds_to_read; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->		for (i = 0; i &lt; vfds_to_read; i++) {<!----></span><br>			uint32_t vfd_id = le32_to_cpu(vfds_le[i]);<span class="line"><!---->			uint32_t vfd_id = le32_to_cpu(vfds_le[i]);<!----></span><br>			vfds[read_count] = idr_find(&vi->vfds, vfd_id);      [3] attacker can assign the same vfd_id, make vfds contains the same vfd object<span class="line"><!---->			vfds[read_count] = idr_find(&amp;vi-&gt;vfds, vfd_id);      [3] attacker can assign the same vfd_id, make vfds contains the same vfd object<!----></span><br>			if (vfds[read_count]) {<span class="line"><!---->			if (vfds[read_count]) {<!----></span><br>				read_count++;<span class="line"><!---->				read_count++;<!----></span><br>			} else {<span class="line"><!---->			} else {<!----></span><br>				pr_warn("virtwl: received a vfd with unrecognized id: %u\n",<span class="line"><!---->				pr_warn("virtwl: received a vfd with unrecognized id: %u\n",<!----></span><br>					vfd_id);<span class="line"><!---->					vfd_id);<!----></span><br>			}<span class="line"><!---->			}<!----></span><br>			qentry->vfd_offset++;<span class="line"><!---->			qentry-&gt;vfd_offset++;<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br><br>		vfd_qentry_free_if_empty(vfd, qentry);<span class="line"><!---->		vfd_qentry_free_if_empty(vfd, qentry);<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	return read_count;<span class="line"><!---->	return read_count;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>If attacker can control recv buffer, attacker can make vfds list contains the same vfd object[1][2][3], then all file->private_data pointer to the same vfd object[4],<span class="line"><!---->If attacker can control recv buffer, attacker can make vfds list contains the same vfd object[1][2][3], then all file-&gt;private_data pointer to the same vfd object[4],<!----></span><br>when the process exit and call virtwl_vfd_release to release fds, it will tigger an use after free.<span class="line"><!---->when the process exit and call virtwl_vfd_release to release fds, it will tigger an use after free.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 110.0.5481.181<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 110.0.5481.181<!----></span><br>Operating System: chromeos 5.10.159-20950-g3963226d9eb4<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: chromeos 5.10.159-20950-g3963226d9eb4<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>I audit this vulnerability and still working for a poc.<span class="line"><!---->I audit this vulnerability and still working for a poc.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        FYI:<span class="line"><!---->FYI:<!----></span><br><br>The exploitation path would be VMM->guest or guest->(via VMM)->guest (since the guest itself could trigger the exploit). But with just this bug, I don't see any feasible way for the guest to exploit the VMM.<span class="line"><!---->The exploitation path would be VMM-&gt;guest or guest-&gt;(via VMM)-&gt;guest (since the guest itself could trigger the exploit). But with just this bug, I don't see any feasible way for the guest to exploit the VMM.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1424269#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 19, 2023, 11:18 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Severity-Low Security_Severity-Medium Pri-1
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Severity-Low Security_Severity-Medium Pri-1
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Exploitability - Explain why/why not the bug is reachable and/or exploitable For example, if a bug mentions a race, details are needed about how easy that race would be to achieve / can the attack retry infinite times to win the race, etc..<span class="line"><!---->Exploitability - Explain why/why not the bug is reachable and/or exploitable For example, if a bug mentions a race, details are needed about how easy that race would be to achieve / can the attack retry infinite times to win the race, etc..<!----></span><br><br>The path of exploitation here is host->guest via virtio-wl. The bug can potentially exploit a freed file descriptor if they control the recv buffer in the host user space.<span class="line"><!---->The path of exploitation here is host-&gt;guest via virtio-wl. The bug can potentially exploit a freed file descriptor if they control the recv buffer in the host user space.<!----></span><br><br>Note there was no evidence of exploitation provided and just a speculative potential security bug.<span class="line"><!---->Note there was no evidence of exploitation provided and just a speculative potential security bug.<!----></span><br><br>Privileges and Capabilities - Identify which process is exploited and where code execution potentially can be achieved if the attacker can break out of that process, and explain why<span class="line"><!---->Privileges and Capabilities - Identify which process is exploited and where code execution potentially can be achieved if the attacker can break out of that process, and explain why<!----></span><br><br>Host user space to Guest is what can be exploited here, which is a higher privileged process to a lower privileged process.<span class="line"><!---->Host user space to Guest is what can be exploited here, which is a higher privileged process to a lower privileged process.<!----></span><br><br>Origin of fix - Is the issue already known upstream, fixed by work from a previously known or reported issue, provided by the reporter, or any other information that would be relevant toward reward eligibility<span class="line"><!---->Origin of fix - Is the issue already known upstream, fixed by work from a previously known or reported issue, provided by the reporter, or any other information that would be relevant toward reward eligibility<!----></span><br><br>It was fixed upstream and is a new issue.<span class="line"><!---->It was fixed upstream and is a new issue.<!----></span><br><br>Mitigation - Detail any regarding mitigation considerations (we're run across a few comments, such as "we considered this issue to be highly mitigated" without explanation)<span class="line"><!---->Mitigation - Detail any regarding mitigation considerations (we're run across a few comments, such as "we considered this issue to be highly mitigated" without explanation)<!----></span><br><br>The bug goes from user->guest, which in theory can be expected, i.e going from a high to a low privileged process<span class="line"><!---->The bug goes from user-&gt;guest, which in theory can be expected, i.e going from a high to a low privileged process<!----></span><br><br>Severity assessment - why not higher, why not lower .<span class="line"><!---->Severity assessment - why not higher, why not lower .<!----></span><br><br>Medium Severity: This could allow the attacker to "allow attackers to read or modify limited amounts of information" in the guest userspace. Which already is very limited. It is also "Memory corruption in a system service that's not directly triggerable from an exposed interface"<span class="line"><!---->Medium Severity: This could allow the attacker to "allow attackers to read or modify limited amounts of information" in the guest userspace. Which already is very limited. It is also "Memory corruption in a system service that's not directly triggerable from an exposed interface"<!----></span><br><br>Why not High Severity? There is no low->high privileged bypass happening here which would make it high.<span class="line"><!---->Why not High Severity? There is no low-&gt;high privileged bypass happening here which would make it high.<!----></span><br><br>Why not Low Severity? I think there is a case that be made here that this is a low severity, since there are high mitigation factors (such as being in the userspace), but this also potentially allows for malicious users to read/modify such information that could be used in a higher severity bug."<span class="line"><!---->Why not Low Severity? I think there is a case that be made here that this is a low severity, since there are high mitigation factors (such as being in the userspace), but this also potentially allows for malicious users to read/modify such information that could be used in a higher severity bug."<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;

        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);

        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is an use after free in virtwl_ioctl_recv(drivers/virtio/virtio_wl.c):<span class="line"><!---->There is an use after free in virtwl_ioctl_recv(drivers/virtio/virtio_wl.c):<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static long virtwl_ioctl_recv(struct file *filp, void __user *ptr)<span class="line"><!---->static long virtwl_ioctl_recv(struct file *filp, void __user *ptr)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>	ret = virtwl_vfd_recv(filp, user_data, ioctl_recv.len, vfds, [1] vfds come from recv buffer<span class="line"><!---->	ret = virtwl_vfd_recv(filp, user_data, ioctl_recv.len, vfds, [1] vfds come from recv buffer<!----></span><br>			      &vfd_count);<span class="line"><!---->			      &amp;vfd_count);<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br><br>	for (i = 0; i < vfd_count; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->	for (i = 0; i &lt; vfd_count; i++) {<!----></span><br>		ret = anon_inode_getfd("[virtwl_vfd]", &virtwl_vfd_fops, [4] vfds contains the same vfd object, all file->private_data pointer to the same vfd object<span class="line"><!---->		ret = anon_inode_getfd("[virtwl_vfd]", &amp;virtwl_vfd_fops, [4] vfds contains the same vfd object, all file-&gt;private_data pointer to the same vfd object<!----></span><br>				       vfds[i], virtwl_vfd_file_flags(vfds[i])<span class="line"><!---->				       vfds[i], virtwl_vfd_file_flags(vfds[i])<!----></span><br>				       | O_CLOEXEC);<span class="line"><!---->				       | O_CLOEXEC);<!----></span><br>		if (ret < 0)<span class="line"><!---->		if (ret &lt; 0)<!----></span><br>			goto free_vfds;<span class="line"><!---->			goto free_vfds;<!----></span><br><br>		vfds[i] = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->		vfds[i] = NULL;<!----></span><br>		fds[i] = ret;<span class="line"><!---->		fds[i] = ret;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>vfds[i] controlled by attacker in vfd_out_vfds_locked(drivers/virtio/virtio_wl.c):<span class="line"><!---->vfds[i] controlled by attacker in vfd_out_vfds_locked(drivers/virtio/virtio_wl.c):<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static size_t vfd_out_vfds_locked(struct virtwl_vfd *vfd,<span class="line"><!---->static size_t vfd_out_vfds_locked(struct virtwl_vfd *vfd,<!----></span><br>				  struct virtwl_vfd **vfds, size_t count)<span class="line"><!---->				  struct virtwl_vfd **vfds, size_t count)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>        [...]<span class="line"><!---->        [...]<!----></span><br><br>		__le32 *vfds_le = (__le32 *)((void *)recv + vfd_offset); [2] vfds_le parsed from recv buffer<span class="line"><!---->		__le32 *vfds_le = (__le32 *)((void *)recv + vfd_offset); [2] vfds_le parsed from recv buffer<!----></span><br>		[...]<span class="line"><!---->		[...]<!----></span><br><br>		for (i = 0; i < vfds_to_read; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->		for (i = 0; i &lt; vfds_to_read; i++) {<!----></span><br>			uint32_t vfd_id = le32_to_cpu(vfds_le[i]);<span class="line"><!---->			uint32_t vfd_id = le32_to_cpu(vfds_le[i]);<!----></span><br>			vfds[read_count] = idr_find(&vi->vfds, vfd_id);      [3] attacker can assign the same vfd_id, make vfds contains the same vfd object<span class="line"><!---->			vfds[read_count] = idr_find(&amp;vi-&gt;vfds, vfd_id);      [3] attacker can assign the same vfd_id, make vfds contains the same vfd object<!----></span><br>			if (vfds[read_count]) {<span class="line"><!---->			if (vfds[read_count]) {<!----></span><br>				read_count++;<span class="line"><!---->				read_count++;<!----></span><br>			} else {<span class="line"><!---->			} else {<!----></span><br>				pr_warn("virtwl: received a vfd with unrecognized id: %u\n",<span class="line"><!---->				pr_warn("virtwl: received a vfd with unrecognized id: %u\n",<!----></span><br>					vfd_id);<span class="line"><!---->					vfd_id);<!----></span><br>			}<span class="line"><!---->			}<!----></span><br>			qentry->vfd_offset++;<span class="line"><!---->			qentry-&gt;vfd_offset++;<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br><br>		vfd_qentry_free_if_empty(vfd, qentry);<span class="line"><!---->		vfd_qentry_free_if_empty(vfd, qentry);<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	return read_count;<span class="line"><!---->	return read_count;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>If attacker can control recv buffer, attacker can make vfds list contains the same vfd object[1][2][3], then all file->private_data pointer to the same vfd object[4],<span class="line"><!---->If attacker can control recv buffer, attacker can make vfds list contains the same vfd object[1][2][3], then all file-&gt;private_data pointer to the same vfd object[4],<!----></span><br>when the process exit and call virtwl_vfd_release to release fds, it will tigger an use after free.<span class="line"><!---->when the process exit and call virtwl_vfd_release to release fds, it will tigger an use after free.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 110.0.5481.181<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 110.0.5481.181<!----></span><br>Operating System: chromeos 5.10.159-20950-g3963226d9eb4<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: chromeos 5.10.159-20950-g3963226d9eb4<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>I audit this vulnerability and still working for a poc.<span class="line"><!---->I audit this vulnerability and still working for a poc.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        FYI:<span class="line"><!---->FYI:<!----></span><br><br>The exploitation path would be VMM->guest or guest->(via VMM)->guest (since the guest itself could trigger the exploit). But with just this bug, I don't see any feasible way for the guest to exploit the VMM.<span class="line"><!---->The exploitation path would be VMM-&gt;guest or guest-&gt;(via VMM)-&gt;guest (since the guest itself could trigger the exploit). But with just this bug, I don't see any feasible way for the guest to exploit the VMM.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1424269#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 19, 2023, 11:18 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
